title: Brantry Lough near Dungannon Walk Route

description: This circular loop walk takes you around Brantry Lough near Dungannon in County Tyrone. The site has a parking area on the south eastern side of the lake where you can start your walk. From here you can pick up the pleasant, waterside trails around the lough. The trail runs for just under 2.5 km with some fine views across the water. It should take around 45 minutes to complete the walk. The lake is part of the Eglish Heritage Trail and includes some peaceful deciduous woodland as well. If you would like to continue your walking around Dungannon then you could visit the nearby Oxford Island Nature Reserve. The large reserve is located on the shores of Lough Neagh and consists of reed beds, open water, species rich wet grassland, wildlife ponds and wildflower meadows. Please scroll down for the full list of walks near and around Dungannon. The detailed maps below also show a range of footpaths, bridleways and cycle paths in the area.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: To extend your walking in the area you could visit the nearby Peatlands Park. Here you'll find miles of trails taking you to peatlands, orchards, woodland, boardwalks and two nature reserves. Just to the west is Marghery country park where there are another 3 miles of woodland walking trails with more great views over Lough Neagh. Just to the north east you will find the historic town of Coalisland where you can enjoy an easy waterside stroll along the Coalisland Canal.
